date_from.title: From the date
date_from.description: Date from which data was downloaded: either the date in YYYY-MM-DD format or a dateparser string, for example, "5 days ago," "1 month ago," "yesterday," etc.

date_to.title: Could you please provide more context or a full sentence so I can better understand and correct any grammar or style errors?
date_to.description: Date to which the data is downloaded: Either a date in YYYY-MM-DD format or a dateparser string such as "5 days ago," "1 month ago," "now," etc.

output_table_name.title: Table Name for Storage
output_table_name.description: Name of the table stored in storage.

load_type.title: Loading Type
load_type.description: If Full load is used, the destination table will be overwritten with every run. If incremental load is used, data will be upserted into the destination table. Tables with a primary key will have rows updated, while tables without a primary key will have rows appended.

primary_keys.title: Primary keys.
primary_keys.description: List of primary keys separated by commas, e.g., id, other_id. If a primary key is set, updates can be done on the table by selecting incremental loads. The primary key can consist of multiple columns. The primary key of an existing table cannot be changed.
